trans-unit.source: Defines the method that a designer-host must implement to provide URL reference look-up for embedded resources.
ASP.NET version 2.0 provides the ability to retrieve embedded resources from an assembly for controls, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> control.
At run time, the URL to the embedded resource can be retrieved using the <xref:System.Web.UI.ClientScriptManager.GetWebResourceUrl%2A> method of the <xref:System.Web.UI.ClientScriptManager> class.
To provide a design-time means for generating a resource URL from an assembly, designer hosts can offer a service that implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.IResourceUrlGenerator> interface.
On using resources in localization, see [ASP.NET Web Page Resources Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0936b3b2-9e6e-4abe-9c06-364efef9dbbd).

On using embedded resources, see [NIB:How to: Use Resources to Set Property Values in Web Server Controls](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d8e0e5c0-1958-422b-b4f5-ebe63f6c45cb) and [How to: Retrieve Resource Values Programmatically](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/7a06d512-6fc3-40ca-9cb6-7f41d1a9fa28).
On control designers, see [ASP.NET Control Designers Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/1d5a99d7-0a72-403e-812e-2c1ab595c810).

The <xref:System.Web.UI.IResourceUrlGenerator> interface has one method, the <xref:System.Web.UI.IResourceUrlGenerator.GetResourceUrl%2A> method, that returns a URL reference to a resource given the resource type and name.
Returns a URL reference to an embedded resource in an assembly that is used at design time.
At run time, the <xref:System.Web.UI.ClientScriptManager.GetWebResourceUrl%2A> method returns a URL to a resource.
The <xref:System.Web.Handlers.AssemblyResourceLoader> class defines the HTTP handler that is used to load embedded resources.

At design time, the <xref:System.Web.UI.ClientScriptManager.GetWebResourceUrl%2A> method of the <xref:System.Web.UI.ClientScriptManager> class detects design mode and delegates to the designer-host service implementation, which returns a URL.
The type in the assembly that contains the embedded resource.
The name of the resource to retrieve.
The URL reference to the resource.
